content.body: Looking at https://github.com/mdn/content/pull/25958/files about `method=dialog` for the `form` element when the `form` is a descendant of a `dialog` element, I don’t find where the spec states that when closing the `dialog`, there is a requirement for it to happen _“without submitting data or clearing the form”_.
content.formatted_body: Looking at https://github.com/mdn/content/pull/25958/files about method=dialog for the form element when the form is a descendant of a dialog element, I don’t find where the spec states that when closing the dialog, there is a requirement for it to happen “without submitting data or clearing the form”.

content.body: What the spec seems to state instead is that if a `form` has `method=dialog` and the `form` is _not_ a descendant of a `dialog`, then in that case the form is not submitted.
content.formatted_body: What the spec seems to state instead is that if a form has method=dialog and the form is not a descendant of a dialog, then in that case the form is not submitted.

content.body: (Though even in that case the spec doesn’t explicitly state any separate requirement about clearing the form.)

* What the spec at https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/form-control-infrastructure.html#attr-fs-method seems to state instead is: If a `form` has `method=dialog` and the `form` is _not_ a descendant of a `dialog`, then in that case the form is not submitted.
content.formatted_body: * What the spec at https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/form-control-infrastructure.html#attr-fs-method seems to state instead is: If a form has method=dialog and the form is not a descendant of a dialog, then in that case the form is not submitted.

m.new_content.body: What the spec at https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/form-control-infrastructure.html#attr-fs-method seems to state instead is: If a `form` has `method=dialog` and the `form` is _not_ a descendant of a `dialog`, then in that case the form is not submitted.
m.new_content.formatted_body: What the spec at https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/form-control-infrastructure.html#attr-fs-method seems to state instead is: If a form has method=dialog and the form is not a descendant of a dialog, then in that case the form is not submitted.

content.body: * Looking at https://github.com/mdn/content/pull/25958/files about `method=dialog` for the `form` element when the `form` is a descendant of a `dialog` element, and looking at the relevant algorithm in the spec at https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/form-control-infrastructure.html#form-submission-algorithm:attr-fs-method-dialog, I don’t find where the spec states that when closing the `dialog`, there is a requirement for it to happen _“without submitting data or clearing the form”_.
content.formatted_body: * Looking at https://github.com/mdn/content/pull/25958/files about method=dialog for the form element when the form is a descendant of a dialog element, and looking at the relevant algorithm in the spec at https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/form-control-infrastructure.html#form-submission-algorithm:attr-fs-method-dialog, I don’t find where the spec states that when closing the dialog, there is a requirement for it to happen “without submitting data or clearing the form”.

m.new_content.body: Looking at https://github.com/mdn/content/pull/25958/files about `method=dialog` for the `form` element when the `form` is a descendant of a `dialog` element, and looking at the relevant algorithm in the spec at https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/form-control-infrastructure.html#form-submission-algorithm:attr-fs-method-dialog, I don’t find where the spec states that when closing the `dialog`, there is a requirement for it to happen _“without submitting data or clearing the form”_.
m.new_content.formatted_body: Looking at https://github.com/mdn/content/pull/25958/files about method=dialog for the form element when the form is a descendant of a dialog element, and looking at the relevant algorithm in the spec at https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/form-control-infrastructure.html#form-submission-algorithm:attr-fs-method-dialog, I don’t find where the spec states that when closing the dialog, there is a requirement for it to happen “without submitting data or clearing the form”.

content.body:
* d’oh, nevermind — only just now I notice that the last substep of step 11 at https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/form-control-infrastructure.html#form-submission-algorithm:attr-fs-method-dialog is an early return…
(Will delete these messages, because it looks like maybe nobody else has read them yet anyway).

m.new_content.body:
d’oh, nevermind — only just now I notice that the last substep of step 11 at https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/form-control-infrastructure.html#form-submission-algorithm:attr-fs-method-dialog is an early return…

content.body: bkardell: looks like it means element.parentNode?.nodeType == DOCUMENT_NODE
content.formatted_body: bkardell: looks like it means element.parentNode?.nodeType == DOCUMENT_NODE

content.body:
> <@ms2ger:igalia.com> bkardell: looks like it means element.parentNode?.nodeType == DOCUMENT_NODE

I mean.. in my head the node type is what i was thinking too.. but Are you saying then the  thing i highlighted in my screenshot above is meaningful? Like.. If that is the whole document or something?
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @ms2ger:igalia.com
bkardell: looks like it means element.parentNode?.nodeType == DOCUMENT_NODE
I mean.. in my head the node type is what i was thinking too.. but Are you saying then the thing i highlighted in my screenshot above is meaningful? Like.. If that is the whole document or something?

content.body: It's phrased a bit weird, but I think it means "there exists a document d for which the element is d's "document element" (root element)

The root question there tho, is, why is *that* condition being used, when it seems like the *intended* condition being checked for is "doesn't have a parent", given that the next and final step is to look at the parent's direction?
content.formatted_body: The root question there tho, is, why is that condition being used, when it seems like the intended condition being checked for is "doesn't have a parent", given that the next and final step is to look at the parent's direction?
